text:
Q: How to get all privileges back to the root user in MySQL? A:

It took me a few hours to find but it turns out it was right in front of me all along.

  1. On the navigator, under management, click "Users and Privileges".

  2. Select root user.

  3. To the right you will see "Details for account root@localhost". Select "Schema Privileges".

  4. Add Entry, choose "All Schema(%)" and click "OK".

  5. Select the Schema and below it, you will see the privileges, or "Rights" as they're listed and you can select all.

Please see my poorly annotated screenshot.

Changing Privilege Settings in MySQL

Q: Testing async context manager fixture in pytest yields unexpected async generator object A:

As Andrew Certain suggested ,i added @pytest_asyncio.fixture and ran using pytest -s test_inputs_async.py so it worked.

import pytest
import pytest_asyncio
from playwright.async_api import async_playwright

# Async fixture marked properly
@pytest_asyncio.fixture
async def page():
    playwright = await async_playwright().start()
    browser = await playwright.chromium.launch(headless=False)
    page = await browser.new_page()
    yield page
    await page.close()
    await browser.close()
    await playwright.stop()

class TestInputsAsync:
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_open_inputs_page(self, page):
        await page.goto("https://the-internet.herokuapp.com/")
        await page.get_by_role("link", name="Inputs").click()

    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_fill_input_number(self, page):
        await page.goto("https://the-internet.herokuapp.com/inputs")
        await page.get_by_role("spinbutton").click()
        await page.get_by_role("spinbutton").fill("666")

Q: Flink 1.20: kafka sink job fails with endofinput exception when restoring from savepoint A:

this issue was fixed in flink 1.20.3

for details refer to: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-37605

Q: What is in Angular the correct term of a public property in an object component that contains form data or display data? A:

The model is only the "json object".

We talk about "form-model" to reference to the "control". It's more easy understand when you use ReactiveForms or FormSignal: the "form-model" is the formGroup or the form signal (a complex object with properties of value, binding, valuesChange...

When use [ngModel] you create also a NgControl with these properties about value, binding valueChange..., (but it's some "transparent" because you use a directive in the .html). You can say that "item.name" it's not only a property of item, else a NgControl, or a "form-model" of this property.

So, item is only a model and it's not related to the server (can be,e.g. a variable)
